tldr: The Kew Committee's report covers the operations and findings of Kew Observatory from 1855 to 1885. The report discusses various observations and experiments conducted in the fields of magnetism, meteorology, astronomy, and solar physics. The committee also worked on improving and testing various instruments, including magnetographs, anemometers, and solar radiation thermometers. The report provides a summary of the number of meteorological observations made during the year, as well as the results of experiments and observations related to atmospheric electricity, cloud motions, and solar radiation.
